definition: (final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)

sentences.english: The carrying pole creaked under the load.
The carrying pole creaked under the load.
Old dwelling Wooden staircases, with the noise of creak when you set foot on it.
sentences.chinese: 《老宅院》木質的樓梯，踏上去咯吱咯吱地作響。

sentences.english: Old dwelling Wooden staircases, with the noise of creak when you set foot on it.
sentences.chinese: 《老宅院》木質的樓梯，踏上去咯吱咯吱地作響。

sentences.english: Occasionally heard "creak" A snow pressure to cut off the branches.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾會傳來“咯吱”一聲，積雪把樹枝壓斷了。

sentences.english: Creaky wardrobe. No use disturbing her.
sentences.chinese: 衣櫥總咯吱咯吱響，犯不上去打擾她。

sentences.english: Creaky wardrobe. No use disturbing her.
sentences.chinese: 衣櫥總咯吱咯吱響，犯不上去打擾她。

sentences.english: He squashed  home on the snow ground.
sentences.chinese: 他咯吱咯吱地踏着雪走回了家。

sentences.english: He squashed  home on the snow ground.
sentences.chinese: 他咯吱咯吱地踏着雪走回了家。

sentences.english: Immediately a chorus of angry chattering and screeching breaks out.
sentences.chinese: 頓時爆發出一陣憤怒的咯吱聲和尖叫聲。

sentences.english: The soaking wet sneakers squished as he walked.
sentences.chinese: 他走路時，他的溼膠鞋發出咯吱咯吱的聲響。

sentences.english: The soaking wet sneakers squished as he walked.
sentences.chinese: 他走路時，他的溼膠鞋發出咯吱咯吱的聲響。

sentences.english: The rabbit munched on the fresh carrots.
sentences.chinese: 兔子咯吱咯吱地嚼着新鮮胡蘿蔔。

sentences.english: The rabbit munched on the fresh carrots.
sentences.chinese: 兔子咯吱咯吱地嚼着新鮮胡蘿蔔。

sentences.english: The cart creaked across the green.
sentences.chinese: 大車咯吱咯吱地從青草地上走過去。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
